intro: Aldama perennans, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
